snippet: Swedish officials said that three of the four claims against Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, may never be investigated, but one, of rape, could continue for a further five years.
abstract: Swedish officials report that three of four claims of sexual assault against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange may escape investigation due to statute of limitations laws; fourth and most serious charge of rape, however, can remain active for another five years; Assange remains in hiding in London in an attempt to evade extradition to United States by Sweden.
lead_paragraph: Swedish officials said that three of the four claims against Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, may never be investigated, but one, of rape, could continue for a further five years.

headline.main: Time Is Running Out on Part of Assange Sex Assault Investigation
headline.print_headline: Time Is Running Out on Part of Assange Investigation
